intro: Maxillaria simplex, commonly known as the small-lobed orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. The plant has pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients, and its leaves are typically elliptical and革质 (leathery). It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Maxillaria simplex is popular among orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
